page.title: 12Farming in Abergavenny
page.content: Abergavenny is a mixed farming area with arable,dairy and sheep-rearing. The most important was dairy but this has gone downhill since the Government changed its mind about paying farmers to produce moremilk and now pay them to give up being dairy farmers.Instead many dairy farmers turned to beef production for prices were 10 pounds per calf in 1971 but now are 150 pounds There are now more arable farms around Abergavenny than dairy farms.Market gardening has also become important in the area with Wernddu and Tredillion being the most important growers.The main crops are strawberries,raspberries and gooseberries but apples and plums are also grown.Sheep-rearing also is important in the life of many farms around Abergavenny.
